evs.utilities
Class StringUtilities

java.lang.Object
  evs.utilities.StringUtilities

public class StringUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Collection of static methods for manipulating strings.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

getAbsolutePath

public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String relativePath)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns an absolute path for the specified relative path, eliminating problems with white spaces (%20) in Java for windows and safe for reference to resources with JAR archives.

Parameters:
relativePath - the relative path
Returns:
the correct absolute path
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:
first - the first string
second - the second string
emptyAsNull - is true to treat empty strings as null, false otherwise
Returns:
true if both inputs are null or both inputs are not null and equal, false otherwise

processFileName

public static java.lang.String processFileName(java.lang.String input)
Processes an input string so that it comprises a legal file name on any OS. All blanks and '.' characters are replaced with underscore '_' characters.

Parameters:
input - the input name
Returns:
the valid file name

cleanPath

public static java.lang.String cleanPath(java.lang.String path)
Cleans a path to remove all backslashes and replace with the System.getProperty("file.separator")

Parameters:
path - the input path

parseDate

public static java.util.Calendar parseDate(java.lang.String token,
                                           java.lang.String format,
                                           java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                           boolean lenient)
                                    throws DateFormatException
Parses a string with a specified date format to an instance of Calendar. The parser will interpret the input token using the specified date format. The parser may adopt a lenient or non-lenient interpretation of the token using the input date format. See DateFormat.parse(java.lang.String, java.text.ParsePosition).

Parameters:
token - the date
timeZone - the timeZone
lenient - is true to conduct lenient parsing, false otherwise
Returns:
an instance of Calendar or null if the date was not parsed
Throws:
DateFormatException

parseDate

public static java.lang.String parseDate(java.lang.Object time)
Parses an object representing a time and returns a string. If the object is an instance of Calendar, the default date format is used. Set the default format with setDateString().

Parameters:
time - the date
Returns:
a string representation of the time

parseDate

public static java.lang.String parseDate(java.util.Calendar time,
                                         java.lang.String format)
Parses a Calendar representing a time and returns a string.

Parameters:
time - the date
format - the format
Returns:
a string representation of the time

stackTraceToString

Returns a string representation of the stack trace for an error or exception.

Parameters:
ex - the throwable item
Returns:
the stack trace

printWithDates

public static void printWithDates(int column,
                                  DoubleMatrix2D input)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Pretty prints a double matrix with hours relative to the epoch in the specified column. The output is printed to standard out and uses real dates in the format specified by writeDateFormat in this class. The remaining columns are printed as normal. The time system of the output is UTC.

Parameters:
column - the column containing times in hours relative to the epoch
input - the input matrix
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getPaddedNumber

public static java.lang.String getPaddedNumber(double n,
                                               int count)
Returns a string representation of the number with a given number of digits padding on the left.

Parameters:
n - the number
count - the digit count on the left

Returns the index of an input string in the specified array or -1.

Parameters:
input - the input array
test - the string to test
Returns:
the index of the test string in the input or -1
